result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D. Duve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court
Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court
Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1083 (incl. DNA surcharge) + $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $1183, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing in May 2015 on whichever date that Mr. Duve pays fines/costs on cases 13CM231 & 13CM217 and on that same day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 21 day jail term, with work release and Huber privileges, may be served in another county's jail so long as it was at no expense to the County of Jefferson.

Pursuant to the February 2015, Standing Order of the Jefferson County Circuit Court the defendant is to pay Attorney fees in the amount of $686

--Failure to pay as ordered by the Court will result in 15 days jail, consecutive with huber.

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

07-21-2015 - Order for payment of attorney fees of $386.90

Case called at 3:01pm [mo]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court is presented with an Amended Information; the Court accepts the Amended Information

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Amended Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified, ADA Beck notes the victim is present in the gallery and does not wish to make a statement; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court reviews the Victim Impact Statement 
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Duve

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1083 (incl. DNA surcharge) + $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $1183,to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing in May 2015 on whichever date that Mr. Duve pays fines/costs on cases 13CM231 & 13CM217 and on that same day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 23 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
recess:3:38pm

Case called at 2:18pm [mo]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Laitsch confirms receipt of the State's response to the Court's Scheduling Order and has no objections.
Atty. Laitsch requests 1 alternate juror be carried.
Atty. Laitsch indicates a one day jury trial is enough time.

The Court addresses procedural matters related to Jury Trial: 
--1 alternate juror to be carried
--each party is allowed 5 strikes
--the jurors will be allowed to ask questions and take notes, 
--follow JI-57
--no individual viore dire of jurors
--no additional questions of jurors

On the State's 3/20/15 Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/ Adjudications:
--Atty. Laitsch verifies receipt
--The Court find that the non-felony and aged convictions are not probative 
--The Court finds that for purposes of Trial Mr. Duve has been convicted of 4 crimes

On the State's 3/20/15 Notice of Intent to Admit Statements made by the Defendant: 
--Atty. Laitsch verifies receipt
--Atty. Laitsch has no objection to the bracketed statements being admitted
--The Court grants the State's Notice of Intent

On the Defense's 3/19/15 Motion in Limine:
--As to Paragraph 1
---No Objection from ADA Beck
---The Court grants 
--As to Paragraph 2
---No Objection from ADA Beck
---The Court grants 
--As to Paragraph 3
---No Objection from ADA Beck
---The Court grants 
--As to Paragraph 4
---No Objection from ADA Beck
---The Court grants 

As to the Defense's 3/19/15  Proposed Jury Instructions:
--ADA Beck has no objection
--The Court grants

As to the Defense's 3/19/15 Notice of Trial Motions and Trial Motions
--The Court grants the Defense's Trial Motions; with the exception:
----paragraph 2 is granted but the right for the victim to be present for the Trial is reserved
---paragraph 7, witness Sharon Ludwig has 1 prior conviction for purposes of Trial (The State is to advise Ms. Ludwig)

As to the State's 3/20/15 Proposed Jury Instructions
--No objections
--The Court grants

recess: 2:47pm

NEXT: (1) FSSC: 4/20/15 AT 3:00PM (2) JURY TRIAL 4/23 OR 4/24/15 AT 8:30AM ((already scheduled))

Case called at 9:30am[MO]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Duve. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
Atty. Laitsch indicates that after many discussions with the State, they have not yet reached an agreement, and requests a trial date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:38
[Off record: Clerk confirms there are no address changes]

case called at 8:44am. [MK]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Duve waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
The Court informs the parties that this case will transfer to Branch III as of January 1st.
Mr. Duve verifies that the Brad Street address remains current.
recess 8:47am.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/21/15 at 9:20am.  (2) case is referred to Branch III for further scheduling

[Clerk: MK]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

On Motion of the Defense, the Court amends the bond from a $150 cash bond to a $500 signature bond (clerk is to refund the cash amount to the surety), with conditions: 
-Maintain Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of any intoxicants
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Sharon Ludwig
- Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. 
recess: 8:38 am


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/15/14 at 1:00pm  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing approximately 3 weeks after the Pretrial date
Adjourned initial appearance on September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Request to Reschedule 9/8/14 Adjourned Initial Appearance is granted
No objection from the State to rescheduling the Adjourned Initial Appearance
Letter from Attorney Laitsch requesting the adjourned initial appearance date be rescheduled
Order appointing counsel endorsed by Attorney Laitsch w/cover letter
Court Appointed Billing Information
The Court appoints Attorney Laitsch, repayment to be addressed at conclusion of case

Adjourned initial appearance on September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 9:45 am
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading conducted; charge and maximum penalties recited.

Court continues the $150 CASH bond, with additional non-monetary conditions:
-Maintain Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of any intoxicants
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Sharon Ludwig
- Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 8/14/14 at 2:00 pm.
-Defendant must appear at the 9/8/14 Adjourned Initial Appearance at 10:00 am

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Defendant requests that the Court adjourn the initial appearance to allow him to appear with counsel.
Court will adjourn the initial appearance to allow the defendant time to seek counsel.

recess: 10:03 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Adjourned Initial Appearance: 9/8/14 at 10:00 am
